CAPTION FIG1.png: 'Figure 1. The proposed structural equation model examining the influence of strength of party ties, reliance, selective exposure, and avoidance and polarization on confidence in Congress and the president.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG2.png: 'Figure 2: Influence [beta weights] of blog reliance and strength of party ties on selective exposure/selective avoidance, polarization and confidence in the government. _Note_. Maximum likelihood estimation of simultaneous multiple regression analyses were performed to test all direct paths in the proposed model. **\\(p<.01\\). ***\\(p<.001\\).\n\n'
CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: Influence (beta weights) of social network site (SNS) reliance and strength of party ties on selective exposure/selective avoidance, polarization and confidence in the government. Note. Maximum likelihood estimation of simultaneous multiple-regression analyses were performed to test all direct paths in the proposed model. **_p_ < .01. ***_p_ < .001.\n\n'
CAPTION FIG4.png: 'Figure 4: Influence {beta weights} of Twitter reliance and strength of parity ties on selective exposure/selective avoidance, polarization and confidence in the government. Note. Maximum likelihood estimation of simultaneous multiple regression analyses were performed to test all direct paths in the proposed model. "p<.05. "*p < .01. ***p < .001.\n\n'
CAPTION TAB1-2.png:
'Note. Conventional standards suggest that a desirable model should entail root mean square error of approximation < .08, a comparative fit index > .9, Tucker-Lewis fit index > .9, and standardized root mean square residual < .05.

* df = 4.

*** p < .001.

'
CAPTION TAB2-2.png:
'Note. Cell entries are standardized coefficients from maximum likelihood estimation of simultaneous multiple regression analyses under the structural equation modeling framework. SNS = social network site.

**_p_ < .01. ***_p_ < .001.

'
